summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department, providing the password for a disc containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the signatory of the letter, providing the password for discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being provided.

connections.description: Strauss, as United States Attorney, is involved in the prosecution of Maxwell, as indicated by the provision of discovery materials.

events.title: Password Transmission for Discovery
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a disc containing discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (case number 20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password 'USAOsdnyll' for a disc containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell, who is identified by inmate number 02879-509.
The letter is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was likely held.
Audrey Strauss, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signed the letter, indicating her direct involvement in the case.
